alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 1:49AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Tammany and southern Washington Parishes, Hancock and Pearl River Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 149 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Franklinton to near Sun to 13 miles west of McHenry. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Bogalusa, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Covington, Waveland, Franklinton, Poplarville, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Folsom, Sun, Kiln, Pearlington, Lacombe, Enon, Crossroads and Shoreline Park. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 262 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 12 between mile markers 53 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock
